instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi randomly disappears. fan 100% intermittently
threads.message:
Hey guys.

Everything works well except the issues mentioned in the title.

I have tested the resistors around fan connector. all seem well. also changed <TRANSISTOR>Q5660</TRANSISTOR>. fan still 100%

where to hunt? is this common problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi randomly disappears. fan 100% intermittently
threads.message:
Check for corrosion around J3401.
Remove the conductive sponge, if present on top.

Fan spins high because of ALS issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi randomly disappears. fan 100% intermittently
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi randomly disappears. fan 100% intermittently
threads.message:
Try another display assembly, for test.
Camera and airport are both connected on J3401, as bluetooth too.
You can change airport board, to diagnose wifi problem.
But Ambient LIght Sensor is embedded on the display, as camera too...
Did you peel out that sponge?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi randomly disappears. fan 100% intermittently
threads.message: Yeah i already peeled sponge, this is 2nd wifi module i change also. It works sometimes and then other times just disappers. I have inspected connector and pins everything looks good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi randomly disappears. fan 100% intermittently
threads.message:
If you have two different problems in one connector, guess what?
Change connector...

Did you try other LCD assembly?
This will give more info about ALS error.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wifi randomly disappears. fan 100% intermittently
threads.message:
Try another airport card or isight airport cable. These are common failures on Macbook pro from 2008-2010.

these cable are too thick, when one wire break it will short the uninsulated ground wires.
